required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rhomboid Intercostal and Subserratus Plane Block
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Efficacy of Unilateral Rhomboid Intercostal and Subserratus Plane Block Application for Postoperative Analgesia in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopic surgery is frequently used today for abdominal region operations. Laparoscopy has become the preferred treatment for cholecystectomy. Patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy suffer from acute postoperative pain despite the multimodal analgesic regimen. For this type of surgery, many different field blocks have been used for postoperative analgesia.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the analgesic efficacy of Unilateral Rhomboid intercostal and subserratus block was investigated in patients who had laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

secondary_outcome.description: Numeric Rating Scale was used for pain.Pain intensity was measured using Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable).
Numeric Rating Scale was used for pain.Pain intensity was measured using Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after the block administration and at the postoperative 2nd hour
secondary_outcome.description: Dermatomal dispersion of sensorial block to the cold stimulus.

arm_group.description: Unilateral Rhomboid intercostal and subserratus block + intravenous patient-controlled analgesia

intervention.description: unilateral Rhomboid intercostal and subserratus block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiology physical status I and II and who gave consent for the blocks were included in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- bleeding disorders,
- mental incapacity,
- known allergy to the local anesthetics,
- body mass index ≥35 kg/m2

overall_official.affiliation: Sağlık Bilimleri Üniversitesi Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Eğitim Ve Araştırma Hastanesi

facility.name: Bursa Yuksek Ihtisas Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital
